comment: Class was really easy, we had 2 modules a week and one had a discussion post. Content was really easy to find.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great Teacher. Either a quiz or a discussion post per week, a final exam, and two essay papers. She's very organized. Very recommended.

Dr. Lefebvre is a great teacher! I enjoyed her online lectures, they were short, easy to understand, and had an interactive minigame to reinforce the material. The class includes 1 quiz every week, 1 discussion post every other week, and 2 tests.
I took this course online. Professor Lefebvre is very fair. The work is very doable and the lectures weren't long or boring. Make sure you take notes and you'll do just fine.
Very easy professor and class. She posted lectures that were short and easy to understand. The quizzes were easy and some material came from the textbook.
This research methods class wasnt easy, however professor has open communication. She gives great feedback & makes it easy to want to do the work.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Dr. Lefebvre was really a good professor HOWEVER her class is not easy. You do have to take good notes and pay attention to the lessons provided on D2L. I would take her again now that i understand how she writes her test and quizzes. Take good notes and you will do good! *text book was free and i used it every quiz and exam
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. LeFebvre was interesting and knowledgeable. She has a paper you have to watch an episode of Star Trek and apply the theories of just war. That was the stupidest thing I have ever had to do and I am in college for the second time so I have experience. Other than that, she was good. Fair grader (tests a little more harsh than papers). Read!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: Easy, basic history class: quiz every week, discussion post every other week, midterm & final. all multiple choice, not hard. Textbook is free online
Tests were open note but I guess that doesn't matter if the information is nonexistent in the lectures and textbook. Tests are very hard. 2/10

She is really nice and the class is pretty easy. Decent amount of reading, but if you go to class and take notes you'll be alright. Weekly quizzes, 2 op-eds (short essays), and midterm/final make up your grades. The 2 tests take up huge chunks of your grade and they are kinda difficult. Overall easy class.

I'm only in my first week with Professor Lefebvre and I already know this is gonna be an easy class. The work she assigns is super easy, and as previous posts have said, she's a good professor who cares a lot about her students. Make sure you study, take good notes, and follow through with everything!

Professor Lefebvre was a great teacher and she was really great at giving lectures and notes. you do have to use a textbook for this class but it is free and all of her tests and quizzes are open note. she can be a harsh grader but if you take notes it wont be too hard. overall, amazing professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: easy class. good teacher who cares. warning:midterm and final were difficult except if you study hard
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: All of her quizzes were on quizlet, but the midterm and final were not, so if you don't do the material, you wont do well on them. There is a lot of reading: a lesson every week plus 1 or 2 chapter(s) in the textbook. Some of our assignments were very vague but she grades pretty easy. She also responds quickly to emails which was very helpful
Super straightforward with expectations and is easily accessible outside of class for any help.

Syllabus and course material were extremely organized. Lectures were excellent (i.e. pace, tone, content)! Easy to follow, easy to understand. I am very impressed with Dr. Becky and have already signed up for another course in the fall. Best online class taken so far.
KSU needs more professors like her. Your success matters to her.

Took her POLS 1101 class online and it was an EASY A. Each week had one quiz or one discussion post. You get a 100 just for posting and the quizzes all have easy to find quizlet answers. Couldn't have made a better selection on this course.

She is a professor that cares about her students. She is always available to help her students so go to her if you are ever struggling. Please take her if you ever have a chance. Kennesaw State really needs more professors like her.

Dr. LeFebvre is one of the sweetest professors at KSU. I would take any other classes with her. She's really passionate about what she teaches and she knows her stuff. Tests are HARD, but do the study guides and you'll be fine. She is a sweetheart and gives extra credit as well! She posts all lectures online, but you need to go for the simulations!

Straight forward teacher that posts her power points online. Book isn't really necessary but can be helpful. Takes attendance on a sign in sheet. Test are not easy but you should get an A or a B if you study. Emails back immediately.
Great teacher. She loves what she teaches. Easy class to get an A if you do the work. Only negative I have is she requires you to do a group project

Can't say enough about her, easy class, great professor! Little work is required for the class, but the subject material is so interesting that you may find yourself using gephi (software used) out of the class. She cares about student's success and interest level in the subject. She makes a required class fun, and I can't say enough good about her

Hybrid class. This teacher was informative, and helpful. Gave reasonable deadlines for assigned work and projects and gave plenty of time in class for projects so work was not to much of a burden outside of class. Easy going teacher with an understanding of the outside world and its requirements.

4 Homework assignments, 3 Papers and a group project. No final. Shes always available for help and makes the subject matter pretty clear to understand. There is a book required, but you hardly ever use it. I'd definitely recommend taking her.

Excellent choice for the STS credit. The class is very easy to keep up with assignments and the material is very straightforward to understand. Dr. LeFebvre really enjoys the subject and always seemed excited to answer student questions. My only disappointment is she doesn't teach any other courses I could take!

She is a very happy person who has a great background and is very informative. There is one homework a week which takes less than 30 minutes. No tests. No attendance requirements. Easy A if you just do the last project using Gephi (which is taught the whole semester).
